publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4792 Ms Rosemary Byrne: School Transport—That the Parliament notes with concern the arbitrary rules set by local authorities by which the mileage limits for school transport are set; further notes that these rules can fail to take into consideration local geography and traffic conditions whereby school pupils may have to walk along busy main roads where school transport is denied, and calls on the Scottish Executive to advise local authorities to set school transport rules which take local geography and traffic conditions into consideration and are based on pupil safety.

S2M-4792 School Transport (lodged on 13 September 2006) Chris Ballance*, Frances Curran*, Carolyn Leckie*, Christine Grahame*, Eleanor Scott*, Alex Neil*, Mr Adam Ingram*, John Swinburne*, Ms Sandra White*
